The tricuspid valve separates the right atrium from the right ventricle. The right ventricle pumps oxygen-depleted blood into the lungs through the pulmonary artery. The left atrium receives oxygen-rich blood from the lungs through the pulmonary veins. It then pumps this blood into the left ventricle. The left ventricle then pumps the oxygen-rich blood into the aorta, which carries it to all parts of the body. Therefore, the correct sequence would be 2 -> 5 -> 4 -> 3 -> 1.
